newsitem.title: USA: NYC presses Time Warner to carry Fox channel.
newsitem.headline: NYC presses Time Warner to carry Fox channel.

text.p: New York City Mayor Rudolph Giuliani's administration has increased efforts to convince Time Warner Inc to carry News Corp Ltd's new 24-hour Fox news channel on a public access cable station that the city controls, the New York Times reported Saturday.

City officials have suggested that if Time Warner refuses, it could affect whether the city renews the company's lucrative cable franchises next week, the newspaper said. Time Warner's contract with the city expires in 1998.
A Time Warner spokesman refused comment on the situation. News Corp was not immediately available for comment.

Giuliani said he was attempting to help News Corp, because of the number of jobs the Manhattan-based Fox channel provides for the city. He stated that if the 24 hour channel was not shown in much of the city, the venture may be unsuccessful, threatening hundreds of New York jobs, the article said.
Time Warner is supporting a rival service owned by General Electric Co's NBC and Microsoft Corp.
